articles.title: What does xG predict for the rest of the season?
articles.summary: With more than half the season gone, we have enough stats to get a good idea of how well Premier League teams have been playing and therefore how things will likely unfold in the months ahead.

articles.title: Hearts 'underdogs by long shot' but still setting Premiership pace
articles.summary: If it seemed Hearts made a statement by winning with 10 men at Dundee on Sunday, they upped the ante against St Mirren four days later.

articles.title: O'Neill calls for patience on Celtic transfers
articles.summary: The Celtic manager Martin O'Neill says "cut me a little bit of slack" as the club work on bringing in new faces this month.

articles.title: Sanchez mistakes 'on me' - Rosenior defends Chelsea keeper
articles.summary: Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior defends goalkeeper Robert Sanchez following two mistakes in his side's 3-2 defeat at home to Arsenal on Wednesday in their Carabao Cup semi-final first-leg tie.

articles.title: World Football
articles.summary: Lee James and guests provide immediate reaction to Morocco and Senegal's semi-final wins.

articles.title: Raducanu in line for Sabalenka rematch after Australian Open draw
articles.summary: Emma Raducanu has been handed a tough path at the Australian Open despite being seeded, with world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka potentially awaiting in the third round.

articles.title: Mane destroys Salah's Afcon dream again - will he get another chance?
articles.summary: Mohamed Salah's Afcon dream was ended by Sadio Mane and Senegal on Wednesday night - but how many more chances will the Liverpool forward have to win the competition?

articles.title: Is Wenger's daylight idea the solution to fix offside?
articles.summary: Is the offside law about to change to Arsene Wenger's daylight idea? And should football make that change just because of VAR?

articles.title: Why has no English boss won Premier League -  and who could be first?
articles.summary: Why has an English manager not won the Premier League? Chief football writer Phil McNulty explores who could make history.

articles.title: 'If Flick hadn't come, I would have left Barca' - Raphinha
articles.summary: Raphinha has become one of Barcelona's most dependable performers and a decisive figure in their biggest matches, which he credits Hansi Flick for.

articles.title: Football Daily
articles.summary: Will Rosenior drop Sanchez, is Gyokeres good enough and how good can Garnacho be?

articles.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
articles.summary: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

articles.title: Spurs & Villa charged over melee after FA Cup game
articles.summary: Tottenham Hotspur and Aston Villa are charged with misconduct by the Football Association following a melee at the conclusion of Saturday's FA Cup game.

articles.title: Afcon quiz: Name every Africa Cup of Nations winner
articles.summary: With the Africa Cup of Nations kicking off on Sunday, 21 December, can you name every tournament winner?

articles.title: Spurs sporting director Paratici to join Fiorentina
articles.summary: Tottenham Hotspur sporting director Fabio Paratici will leave Spurs at the end of the January transfer window to join Serie A side Fiorentina.

articles.title: 'Major whoopsie' - Holloway expects action after Swindon teamsheet error
articles.summary: Swindon manager Ian Holloway is expecting "action" after substitute Aaron Drinan was missing from their teamsheet in the EFL Trophy win at Luton.

articles.title: Taylor banned from darts for six months after failed drugs test
articles.summary: Dom Taylor has been banned from darts for six months by the Darts Regulation Authority (DRA) after testing positive for cocaine and cannabis at the World Darts Championship.

articles.title: Watch best of Saturday's weather-affected SPFL action
articles.summary: Watch the best of the action from Saturday's weather-affected Scottish Championship, League 1 and League 2 programme.

articles.title: Leeds avoid upset with second-half comeback against Derby
articles.summary: James Justin scored his first goal for Leeds United since joining from Leicester City in the summer, in a second-half comeback after Derby County took the lead thanks to a Ben Brereton Diaz strike.

articles.title: Two for Reed as Mansfield upset Sheff Utd in thriller
articles.summary: Mansfield Town cause one of the shocks of the FA Cup third round with a stunning victory over Sheffield United in a seven-goal thriller at Bramall Lane.
